detaileddescription.para: Init. the animation module

Set a variable to animate function to execute on var
a
pointer to an initialized lv_anim_t variable
var
pointer to a variable to animate
exec_cb
a function to execute. LittelvGL's built-in functions can be used. E.g. lv_obj_set_x

Set the duration and delay of an animation
a
pointer to an initialized lv_anim_t variable
duration
duration of the animation in milliseconds
delay
delay before the animation in milliseconds

Set the start and end values of an animation
a
pointer to an initialized lv_anim_t variable
start
the start value
end
the end value

Similar to lv_anim_set_var_and_cb but lv_anim_custom_exec_cb_t receives lv_anim_t * as its first parameter instead of void *. This function might be used when LittlevGL is binded to other languages because it's more consistent to have lv_anim_t * as first parameter.
a
pointer to an initialized lv_anim_t variable
exec_cb
a function to execute.

Set the path (curve) of the animation.
a
pointer to an initialized lv_anim_t variable
path_cb
a function the get the current value of the animation. The built in functions starts with lv_anim_path_...

Set a function call when the animation is ready
a
pointer to an initialized lv_anim_t variable
ready_cb
a function call when the animation is ready

Make the animation to play back to when the forward direction is ready
a
pointer to an initialized lv_anim_t variable
wait_time
time in milliseconds to wait before starting the back direction

Disable playback. (Disabled after lv_anim_init())
a
pointer to an initialized lv_anim_t variable

Make the animation to start again when ready.
a
pointer to an initialized lv_anim_t variable
wait_time
time in milliseconds to wait before starting the animation again

Disable repeat. (Disabled after lv_anim_init())
a
pointer to an initialized lv_anim_t variable

Set a user specific data for the animation
a
pointer to an initialized lv_anim_t variable
user_data
the user data

Get the user data
a
pointer to an initialized lv_anim_t variable
the user data

Get pointer to the user data
a
pointer to an initialized lv_anim_t variable
pointer to the user data

Create an animation
a
an initialized 'anim_t' variable. Not required after call.

Delete an animation of a variable with a given animator function
var
pointer to variable
exec_cb
a function pointer which is animating 'var', or NULL to ignore it and delete all the animations of 'var
true: at least 1 animation is deleted, false: no animation is deleted

Delete an aniamation by getting the animated variable from a. Only animations with exec_cb will be deleted. This function exist becasue it's logical that all anim functions receives an lv_anim_t as their first parameter. It's not practical in C but might makes the API more conequent and makes easier to genrate bindings.
a
pointer to an animation.
exec_cb
a function pointer which is animating 'var', or NULL to ignore it and delete all the animations of 'var
true: at least 1 animation is deleted, false: no animation is deleted

Get the number of currently running animations
the number of running animations

Calculate the time of an animation with a given speed and the start and end values
speed
speed of animation in unit/sec
start
start value of the animation
end
end value of the animation
the required time [ms] for the animation with the given parameters

Calculate the current value of an animation applying linear characteristic
a
pointer to an animation
the current value to set

Calculate the current value of an animation slowing down the start phase
a
pointer to an animation
the current value to set

Calculate the current value of an animation slowing down the end phase
a
pointer to an animation
the current value to set

Calculate the current value of an animation applying an "S" characteristic (cosine)
a
pointer to an animation
the current value to set

Calculate the current value of an animation with overshoot at the end
a
pointer to an animation
the current value to set

Calculate the current value of an animation with 3 bounces
a
pointer to an animation
the current value to set

Calculate the current value of an animation applying step characteristic. (Set end value on the end of the animation)
a
pointer to an animation
the current value to set
